key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel maintained a pricing consistency of 55.29% over the last week, reflecting a solid alignment with the airline's own pricing.
Approximately 90.8% of offers on the MSE channel were priced lower than those on the airline's website last week, indicating aggressive competition.
The GDS channel showed stable pricing, with a minimal average price difference of just -0.01% compared to the airline's website.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over the last week, the OTA channel maintained a pricing consistency of 55.29%, reflecting offers that matched the airline's own pricing.
In 24.57% of records, fares on the OTA channel were higher compared to the airline's website, indicating potential areas for price re-evaluation.
Short haul routes saw a 13.44% decrease in pricing matches from last week, highlighting greater volatility in fare structures.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 8.53% of fares lacked availability on the OTA channel last week, suggesting a strong competitive presence.
24.57% of routes featured higher prices on the OTA, signaling potential cost concerns for consumers.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: In Canadian markets, price matches were recorded at 65.19%, showcasing a reliable pricing strategy in this region.
Non-Canadian markets showed a higher prevalence of OTA fares being higher, at 52.59%, which may deter purchases through this channel.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For points of origin in Canada, 65.19% of fares matched the airline's prices, reflecting solid regional pricing practices.
Only 4.96% of fares were lower for non-CA origins, indicating less competitive pricing dynamics.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, 51.24% matched the airline's pricing, although they also saw the highest price discrepancies with 25.37% higher on OTAs.
Far out bookings indicated a smaller market presence, with 6.52% of offers lower, reinforcing price sensitivity closer to departure.

mse_highlights.line_content: Approximately 90.8% of offers on the MSE channel were priced lower than the airlineâ€™s website last week.
The percentage of same prices between the MSE channel and the airline's site increased minimally by 0.22% over the last month.
Long haul itineraries showed a 6.60% decrease in the share of MSE lower prices compared to the previous week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, 90.8% of MSE offers were lower than those on the airline's website, indicating strong competitive pricing.
Only 9.22% of offers matched the airline's website prices last week, reflecting a significant pricing differentiation.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: In Canada, 84.18% of prices on the MSE channel were lower than the airline's website, suggesting a price advantage in this market.
Conversely, there was a higher percentage of lower prices for Non-CA routes at 98.52%, indicating strong pricing competition.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Canadian points of origin, 84.18% of MSE prices were lower than the site, highlighting effective local market pricing.
The Non-CA pricing data indicates 98.52% of MSE prices were lower, suggesting aggressive pricing strategies in international markets.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, 90.05% of prices on the MSE channel were lower than the website, demonstrating attractive last-minute offers.
For far-out bookings, 92.47% were priced lower, indicating a consistent low-cost strategy for travelers planning ahead.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel maintains consistent pricing with a monthly average price difference of just -0.01% compared to the airline's website.
Only 3.74% of the analyzed prices were lower on the GDS channel last week, indicating minimal competitive pricing on this channel.
57.51% of prices across all dimensions remained the same when compared to the airline's website last week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 57.51% of prices remained the same across the GDS channel compared to the airline's website last week.
40.82% of prices on the GDS channel were higher than those on the airline's website last week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul pricing showed 3.71% being lower on the GDS, with 38.82% priced higher than the airline's website.
Long haul pricing remained stable, with only 1.63% lower prices compared to the airline's website last week.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the Canadian market, 12.70% of prices were higher on the GDS compared to the airline's website last week.
For Non-Canadian routes, 86.67% of GDS prices were higher than those listed on the airline's website.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed 1.49% of GDS prices lower than the airline's website, with 41.29% priced higher.
Far-out bookings indicated a 8.70% lower pricing occurrence through GDS, suggesting some competitive pricing.
